intro: Hoya vitiensis subsp. vitiensis, commonly known as the Vitiensis Waffleplant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apocynaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Oceania, particularly the island of Vanuatu. The plant is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves and clusters of small, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It is a climbing or trailing plant that often grows along tree trunks or in shaded areas. Hoya vitiensis subsp. vitiensis is popular among succulent and tropical plant enthusiasts due to its unique appearance and relatively low maintenance requirements.
